messages: 4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:09): marcos, got a sec for http://www.w3.org/mid/<email/> ?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:09): artb, yeah, we are talking about it in #wam
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:10): for now, I just want to talk about the XHR req and its use in A+E
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:11): When I read the req, I think it's OK.
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:11): It doesn't say which spec will satisfy it
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:11): in fact, WebApps may never write a spec that says it will be satisified
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:12): but some other SDO e.g. OMTP could make a spec
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:13): Regarding this req and section 3.1 of the A+E spec and XHR depdendency, if it said MUST I'd be concerned
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:13): but with the SHOULD, it's not clear there is a problem here
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:13): i.e. why change what is in the spec?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:14): because it puts an API dependency that is not required and that we are not going to fulfill
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:14): We should take it out
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:15): we have two extremes on the table: 1. include all APIs and Specs and 2. abstract everything (current approach)
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:16): so let me ask this question -> does any part of the A+E spec, as defined in the latest ED (March 26) Require XHR?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:18): Artb, yes, I think it says "a UA must implement XHR"
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:18): "In addition to this specification, a user agent SHOULD support the following specifications:
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:18): * [XMLHttpRequest]"
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:18): well, it was a "should" not a must
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:19): Yes, I see that but I'm asking if for example any of the methods or attributes require XHR
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:19): If the answer is NO then I agree text you quote above should be deleted
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:19): But deleting the related requirement is a separate issue
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:20): And you wan to delete " * [Widgets-Updates]" too, right?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:21): You are correct, no method in the A&E depends on it. There are methods that depend on [Widget-updates]
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:21): OK - I think we are on the same page here i.e. we both want to delete from the A+E spec the following:
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:21): In addition to this specification, a user agent SHOULD support the following specifications:    * [XMLHttpRequest]    * [Widgets-update]
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:21): attribute Function onbeforeupdate;
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:21): attribute Function onafterupdate;
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:22): Seems Arve deleted update();
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:23): I thought we had a discussion about "Which specs depend on Updates?" and the answer was "just P+C".
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:23): I think we should trash those two methods
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:23): they don't make sense anyway
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:23): You can update a widget while its not running
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:24): so those methods are unreliable
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:26): If those two methods are deleted then then the [Widgets-Updates] ref can be deleted too?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:26): right
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:26): I'll propose it
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:26): Why remove the related requirement?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:27): for XHR that is?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:27): in the abstract e.g. for defining a useful "Widget UA", it is a reasonable requirement
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:28): It just doesn't appear to be a requirement that is satisfied by A+E spec
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:28): where would that requirement be addressed?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:29): In a "Widget User Agent" spec, I presume
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:29): Seems that you get XHR for free if you implement HTML5. But if you use flash, you can use XML Sockets or whatever
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:29): Did you say OMTP is defining such a spec?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:30): I can't comment on that right now.
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:33): they may or may not do that. I'm not sure.
